name: Numerology
description:
Numerology

Numerology is a hypercasual, minimalistic and addictive combining game!

Use your mouse or finger to swipe and combine matching numbers which are adjacent (i.e. combine a 4 and a 4 which are vertically or horizontally adjacent). You get points per each number combined. The number you swiped disappears and numbers above it fall down. Combine 9s for big points!!!

It's a simple to learn, yet addictive game that will get you hooked for just one more round!

There are two playable modes:

  • Moves - score as many points as possible in 30 moves.
  • Timed - score as many points as possible in 60 seconds.

Numerology is intended to be a hypercasual game, so mobile version is a most. I will be working on this in the near future. You can already play it on a tablet or touch-enabled laptop using the HTML5 export.

Leaderboard

Numerology includes a global online leaderboard for both game modes! Try to beat the highscores there. Some of those were set during ScoreSpace #12 Jam.

History

The current version is 1.2.0, you can check the itch.io devlog for updates.

This game was made for ScoreSpace #12 Jam and the original release (1.0 and updates up to 1.2.0) were uploaded to the ScoreSpace #12 page in gamejam.com. Note that further updates are only hosted here on itch.io.

Known bugs

    • itch.io embedded version does not like the click to edit Name. For some reason it does not register the name, so you can't change it :/ I've hosted the latest HTML5 version on my VPS for the time being, you can access it by clicking on the link below in files.

Feature backlog

I joined Improve Your Game Jam here in itch.io to further refine this and produce versions 1.2.1+. Here is the feature backlog:

  • Allow automatic shuffling of board when there are no more moves left. Possibly maintain current behavior in a "hard" mode.
  • Ability to shuffle board manually, associated with a certain score penalty.
  • Music on/off, Sound on/off, Board restart buttons.
  • Possibly combos that score more points!
  • Hints display (again, probably maintain current behavior in a "hard" mode)
  • Endless mode!
  • Android version!
